solution_line_template: If the third leg of Rick's trip was half the distance of the first leg, was {third_leg_distance} miles, this means the first leg was {third_leg_distance}*{half_multiplier}=<<{third_leg_distance}*{half_multiplier}={first_leg_distance}>>{first_leg_distance} miles long

If the second leg of the trip was twice the distance of the first leg, that means it was {first_leg_distance}*{second_leg_multiplier}=<<{first_leg_distance}*{second_leg_multiplier}={second_leg_distance}>>{second_leg_distance} miles long

If the fourth leg was equal in distance to the total amount traveled across the first 3 legs, that means it was equal to {third_leg_distance}+{first_leg_distance}+{second_leg_distance}= <<{fourth_leg_distance}={fourth_leg_distance}>>{fourth_leg_distance} miles long
This means in total Rick traveled {fourth_leg_distance}+{fourth_leg_distance}= <<{fourth_leg_distance}+{fourth_leg_distance}={total_distance}>>{total_distance} miles
